column1: Rule 1: Modifiers containing an amino acid structure with a carboxylic acid group and an additional hydroxyl group
column2: Rule 2: Modifiers with a phenyl group directly attached to a carboxylic acid and a hydroxyl or amino substituent on the phenyl ring
column3: Rule 3: Modifiers containing a pyridine ring with additional electron-donating groups
column4: Rule 4: Modifiers with multiple hydroxyl groups on a short carbon chain
column5: Rule 5: Modifiers with sulfur groups without additional stabilizing groups
column6: Rule 6: Modifiers with formyl groups on aromatic rings without additional electron-donating groups
column7: Rule 7: Modifiers with nitro groups on aromatic rings
column8: Rule 8: Modifiers with alkyl chains longer than six carbons and without compensating functional groups
column9: Rule 9: Modifiers with methoxy groups on aromatic rings and additional electron-donating groups
column10: Rule 10: Modifiers with benzofuran or similar heterocyclic structures and additional electron-donating groups
column11: Rule 11: Modifiers with acetamido groups and additional steric hindrance
column12: Rule 12: Modifiers with electron-withdrawing groups such as trifluoromethyl without additional stabilizing interactions
column13: Rule 13: Modifiers with hydroxyl groups on long alkyl chains without additional stabilizing groups
column14: Rule 14: Modifiers with a combination of a carboxylic acid group and a pyridine ring without additional electron-donating groups
column15: Rule 15: Modifiers with a benzene ring containing both electron-withdrawing and electron-donating groups
